title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan, the CEO and MD of India Cements, has resigned following the acquisition of a significant stake by UltraTech Cement.

  • N Srinivasan and board members resigned immediately after UltraTech's 32% acquisition.
  • UltraTech Cement acquired 10.13 crore equity shares, representing 32.72% of India Cements.
  • India Cements is now a subsidiary of UltraTech Cement.
  • N Srinivasan's family members also stepped down from the board.
“The resignation comes due to the consequent cessation of control by the existing promoters over the company.”

This acquisition marks a significant change in the management structure of India Cements and reflects the ongoing consolidation in the cement industry.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan has resigned from his position as CEO and MD of India Cements following UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a 32 percent stake in the company, resulting in its classification as a subsidiary.

  • N Srinivasan and several board members stepped down after the acquisition.
  • The Competition Commission of India approved UltraTech's ₹7,000-crore deal for significant ownership of India Cements.
  • UltraTech now holds approximately 55.49% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • New directors have been appointed to the board post-resignation.
“UltraTech has acquired sole control of the company and has become the promoter.”

This acquisition marks a significant shift in the Indian cement industry, where consolidation and competition between major corporate groups are intensifying.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO of India Cements Following UltraTech Acquisition

The bank behind the fintech revolution stumbles after customer funds go missing | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Crisis at Evolve Bank After Customer Funds Go Missing

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

Scot Lenoir has led Evolve Bank from a regional institution to a prominent player in Silicon Valley, but it now faces a crisis as customers can't access their funds, prompting withdrawals after a business partner failure.

  • Evolve Bank managed around $10 billion for fintech firms like Stripe and Affirm.
  • It provides banks to fintechs that need a partner to handle customer funds.
  • A significant number of customers are affected by the recent issues with accessing their money.
“Evolve Bank turned a sleepy farming bank into one of Silicon Valley’s top financial partners.”

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in the fintech banking model as user trust is undermined.

title: Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Live Mint

As steel prices remain largely stable, the performance of major steel stocks has varied throughout 2024. While Jindal Steel & Power has shown substantial returns, other players like Tata Steel and SAIL face challenges.

  • Jindal Steel & Power Ltd recorded a 27% return this year.
  • Tata Steel and JSW Steel have seen gains up to 5%; SAIL's shares have declined by 4-5%.
  • Factors impacting steel prices include flat domestic prices and increased imports due to weak global demand, particularly from China.
  • Concerns about rising input costs, particularly iron ore, due to proposed mining taxes in Karnataka.
  • Domestic steel demand is expected to remain resilient, but the capacity utilization of the steel industry may drop below 80%.
"Finished steel imports into India are poised to grow by 30%, touching 10 million tonne in CY2024." - Ritabrata Ghosh, ICRA Limited

The outlook for domestic steel prices in 2025 hinges on multiple factors, including international market conditions and government trade policies affecting steel imports.
newTitle: Outlook 2025: Key Factors Affecting Domestic Steel Prices

title: China Sets Another “World Record” With 58,000-Tonne Cargo Ship Akin To Fujian Aircraft Carrier: Chinese Media - EurAsian Times
summary:
China Sets Another 'World Record' With 58,000-Tonne Cargo Ship Akin To Fujian Aircraft Carrier: Chinese Media

Date: December 22, 2024   Source: Chinese Media

China has achieved a new milestone in shipbuilding with the successful trials of the Fan Zhou 8, a 58,000-tonne cargo ship that is now officially seaworthy after completing five days of testing.

  • The Fan Zhou 8 measures 256 meters long and 51 meters wide, with a range of 16,000 nautical miles.
  • It can reach speeds over 15 knots and is classified as polar-ready.
  • The ship’s design allows it to carry a diverse range of cargo, making it a versatile asset in commercial shipping.
  • China’s shipbuilding industry holds 59 percent of global orders, solidifying its leading position.
“Creating such a vessel further strengthens China’s position as a global leader in shipbuilding.”

This record-breaking ship represents China's advancing maritime capabilities and its strategic focus on enhancing its industrial output.
newTitle: China Breaks Shipbuilding Records with 58,000-Tonne Cargo Ship

title: By 2030, 60% of new home buyers will be Millennials and Gen Z in India: JLL Report | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
By 2030, 60% of New Home Buyers in India Will Be Millennials and Gen Z: JLL Report

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: ANI

The JLL report anticipates that Millennials and Gen Z will make up 60% of new home buyers in India by 2030, driven by urbanization, technological innovation, and changing consumer preferences.

  • Millennials are defined as those born from the early 1980s to the early 2000s, while Gen Z covers individuals born from the mid-1990s to the early 2010s.
  • The urban homeownership rate is projected to increase from 65% in 2020 to 72% by 2025.
  • Tier II and III cities are emerging as key growth areas, responsible for over 40% of new housing development by 2025.
  • The housing sector is expected to contribute 13% to India’s national GDP by 2025.
  • Sustainability will play a crucial role, with green-certified buildings expected to double in proportion to new projects by 2025.
  • The market for smart homes and tech-integrated living spaces is rapidly expanding.
  • Residential sales are expected to see a 17% increase in 2024 compared to 2023, with total sales doubling.
"Sustainability, which was once considered a luxury, is now a necessity in the housing market."

In conclusion, the trends indicate a significant shift in the Indian housing market, with Millennials and Gen Z expected to drive demand and influence future developments.
newTitle: By 2030, 60% of New Home Buyers in India Will Be Millennials and Gen Z: JLL Report

title: Ola Electric adds 3,200 new outlets to improve after-sales service - Business Standard
summary:
Ola Electric Expands to 4,000 Outlets to Enhance After-Sales Service

Date: Wednesday, Source: Business Standard

Ola Electric Mobility Ltd has unveiled the opening of 3,200 new stores, bringing its total to 4,000, aimed at improving customer service and expanding its presence in smaller towns.

  • Ola Electric opened 3,200 new stores in response to customer dissatisfaction with its after-sales service.
  • This initiative comes after a challenging year marked by regulatory scrutiny and consumer complaints.
  • The company's direct-to-consumer model aims to make electric vehicle ownership accessible to more households.
  • Ola's chairman emphasized reaching every town and city in India.
  • The company's IPO launched in early August amid fluctuating share prices and strong investor interest.
“Customer complaints averaged 80,000 monthly due to malfunctioning scooters.”

The company's growth strategy seeks to enhance its service network while bolstering consumer trust amid significant market competition.
newTitle: Ola Electric Expands to 4,000 Outlets to Enhance After-Sales Service

title: Trade Setup for December 26: Volatility, low volumes to dominate Nifty moves on final expiry of 2024 - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for December 26: Volatility, low volumes to dominate Nifty moves on final expiry of 2024

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty experienced a volatile trading session, closing below 23,800 due to emerging selling pressure. Despite an optimistic start, the market shifted to a sideways-to-bearish trajectory as the December expiry approaches. Metal stocks emerged as key losers, while Tata Group stocks witnessed a significant surge.

  • The Nifty closed at 23,727.65, down 0.11%, indicating a pause in the uptrend.
  • Selling pressure was prominent near the 23,900 level, leading to a range-bound movement.
  • Tata Capital's potential IPO is anticipated to significantly impact the market.
  • Concerns over a strong dollar and high bond yields contribute to market caution.
  • Key resistance levels for the Nifty are at 23,900-24,000.
  • The Nifty Bank index showed consolidation, with key support at 50,750.
  • Market players should watch for a recovery in stocks such as Nalco India and BPCL.
“The market remains cautious due to various macroeconomic factors affecting investor sentiment.” - Vinod Nair, Geojit Financial Services

In conclusion, as the final trading session of December approaches, traders should remain alert to potential movements influenced by upcoming earnings results and budget announcements.
newTitle: Trade Setup for December 26: Market Volatility Amid Low Volumes

KKR and Bain each bid more than $5 bln for Seven | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Private equity firms KKR and Bain Capital have each made bids exceeding $5 billion for non-core assets of Japan's Seven & i Holdings. The bidding marks a significant move in the retail landscape as Seven & i seeks to divest from various subsidiaries.

  • KKR's bid is approximately 800 billion yen ($5.1 billion) for York Holdings.
  • Bain Capital's offer stands around 1.2 trillion yen.
  • Japan Industrial Partners has also placed a bid of around 750 billion yen.
  • The bids surpass the expected enterprise value of 500 billion yen set by Seven & i.
  • Seven & i aims to finalize the winning bid by February 2024, with significant implications for the company's future.
“The largest privatisation of a Japanese firm, if realised, would mark a historic development in the market,” according to sources.

This bidding round indicates the companies' strategic focus on streamlining operations and responding to competitive pressures in the retail sector.
newTitle: KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

BSE IPO GMP, allotment status: Ventive Hospitality, Senores Pharmaceuticals, Carraro India- here's how to check status | Stock Market News - Mint
Rupee's Real Effective Exchange Rate climbs to 108.14 in Nov: RBI report - Business Standard
summary:
Rupee's Real Effective Exchange Rate climbs to 108.14 in Nov: RBI report

Publication Date: November, 2023

Source: Reserve Bank of India

The Real Effective Exchange Rate (REER) of the rupee appreciated to 108.14 in November, showcasing resilience amidst global market pressures. This report provides insight into the currency's performance in relation to trade competitiveness.

  • REER increased from 107.20 in October to 108.14, marking a 0.9% appreciation.
  • Nominal appreciation is attributed to factors overcoming adverse price differences.
  • Emerging market currencies faced pressure while the rupee showed the lowest volatility among major currencies.
  • REER changes affect trade balance differently; depreciation tends to improve short-term trade, while appreciation has long-term benefits.
  • Several factors influence REER, including productivity, terms of trade, and government spending.
“Our empirical findings on India suggest an asymmetrical impact of REER movements on India’s trade balance,” the report noted.

Overall, while the rupee continues to appreciate, its complex interaction with global and domestic factors makes monitoring its impact on trade crucial for future economic strategies.
newTitle: Rupee's Real Effective Exchange Rate Increases to 108.14 in November According to RBI

title: Applied for DAM Capital IPO shares? Allotment status check online by PAN number on Link Intime - ET Now
summary:
Applied for DAM Capital IPO shares? Allotment status check online by PAN number on Link Intime

Updated: December 25, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

The DAM Capital IPO allotment status will be finalized today, allowing investors to check their status online using their PAN number through the Link Intime website.

DAM Capital IPO Allotment Check

The status can be accessed on the registrar's website: Link Intime.

Steps to Check Allotment Status

  1. Visit the official website of DAM Capital IPO registrar.
  2. Navigate to the IPO allotment status page of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
  3. Select the IPO from the dropdown menu once finalized.
  4. Enter your PAN number and click SUBMIT to view the allotment status.

Additionally, the allotment status will also be displayed on the BSE website.

DAM Capital IPO Subscription Status

The DAM Capital IPO was subscribed 81.88 times overall, with the NII quota subscribed 98.47 times, retail at 26.80 times, and QIB at 166.33 times. The price band was set between Rs 269-283 per share.

DAM Capital IPO GMP Latest

The latest grey market premium (GMP) for DAM Capital IPO is Rs 160 above the upper price band, suggesting a listing price of approximately Rs 443.

DAM Capital IPO Listing Date

The listing date is scheduled for December 27, with trading beginning at 10 AM.

DAM Capital provides various financial services, including investment banking, broking, and research.
newTitle: How to Check DAM Capital IPO Allotment Status Online by PAN Number

title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO listing: Is strong market debut on cards? Check GMP - India Today
summary:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO: Is Strong Market Debut on Cards?

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Source: India Today

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO has garnered significant attention, being subscribed 81.88 times by the end of Day 3 on December 23, 2024, indicating strong investor interest ahead of its market debut on December 27, 2024.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed with the retail investor segment at 26.8 times, QIB at 166.33 times, and NII at 98.47 times.
  • This is a book-built issue valued at Rs 840.25 crore, comprising an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares.
  • The price band of the IPO is set between Rs 269 and Rs 283 per share, with a minimum investment of Rs 14,999.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) currently stands at Rs 170, suggesting a potential listing price of around Rs 453, equating to a 60.07% gain per share.
  • This IPO is managed by Nuvama Wealth Management Limited and registered with Link Intime India Private Ltd.
"Considering the price band of Rs 283, the estimated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 453, calculated by adding the cap price to the GMP."

The anticipation builds as investors look forward to the strong debut of DAM Capital Advisors on the stock exchange this Friday, further driven by positive market sentiment.
newTitle: DAM Capital Advisors IPO Listing: Anticipating a Strong Market Debut
